title: Calories in Frozen Blueberries
meta_description: Learn calories in blueberries frozen per 100g serving, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and quick nutrition facts for easy tracking.
assumptions: Unsweetened frozen blueberries; nutrition based on standard commercial varieties, thawed or as eaten; similar to fresh.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ripeness, freezing process, and added sugars; check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 100g of frozen blueberries provides ~51 kcal, mainly from carbs with good fiber content.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Thawed and drained (slight water loss concentrates nutrients)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g frozen blueberries?
faqs.a: About 51 kcal per 100g of unsweetened frozen blueberries.

faqs.q: Are frozen blueberries lower in calories than fresh?
faqs.a: No, similar at ~51-57 kcal per 100g; freezing preserves most nutrients.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in frozen blueberries?
Do frozen blueberries have added sugars?
faqs.a: Unsweetened varieties have natural sugars (~8.7g per 100g); check labels for sweetened types.

faqs.q: How do calories in blueberries frozen compare to other berries?
faqs.a: Similar to fresh blueberries; lower than strawberries (~32 kcal/100g) but higher carbs.
